oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Four medicine bottles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Collection of four medicine bottles belonging to Dr. G.L. Laws of Lexington, Tenn. Two bottles have labels that read "100 hypodermatic tablets #16, morphine and atropine, R.H. Parke, Davis, & Co. Detroit, MICH." Found on the battlefield at Parker's Crossroads but date to 1871 at the earliest. They are thus post-Civil War era bottles. Dr. Laws studied at the medical department of University of Nashville beginning in 1860 and relocated to Henderson Co. (Tenn) in 1862 to practice medicine.
